storyName: Let the Light of the Past Die
storyInfo: The conflict within the fleet intensifies. Pascuala's golden tongue buys some time, but Thorns's alchemy fails. Javier goes to town to seek a way out for the crew from the Inquisition's persecution.

attributes.content: Mmph... mmph!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Mmphâ€”!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Give it up already, will you?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Don't blame me for handing you over to the Inquisition. We all have to look out for ourselves.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: I'll take the cloth out of your mouths if you'll quiet down.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: (Nods hesitantly)
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I'll be quiet...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Yeah, if you know what's good for you.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: But even if you hand us and the compass over, that doesn't mean things will end well for you. Ever thought about that?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: The bodies of your dead crewmates are still decorating the flagpole outside of town. You sure you won't end up joining them?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: No... Not here either...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Where is that blasted compass? The chaval puts it back here every night!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Is this what you're looking for, Javi?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You shouldn't have come back so soon, Juana.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: On the contrary, I think I returned at precisely the right time.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: SeÃ±ora, I... I don't have a choice.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Put down the knife, Javi. I taught you how to use it. You don't stand a chance.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You're injured. Might not even be hard.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: How did it come to this?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: What dissatisfaction could possibly have driven you to point your blade at me?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I was never unhappy with you. I supported every decision you ever made, every idea you ever had.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: When my mother left me, you took my hand and said we were family.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Ever since then, I've never been unhappy with you.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Then why?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: It's for your good, Juana... for you...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Lies. I'm standing right here.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Tell me! How is it my for own good when you're pointing a blade at me?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The Juana I know wouldn't put the entire fleet in danger for her own selfish desires. She's a brave, wise leader we can trust.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You're not her. You're just a...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Spit it out!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Just a pathetic woman who refuses to face reality, drowning herself in the passions of the past!
attributes.name: Javier
Juana
attributes.content: I've told you time and again...

attributes.name: Juana
attributes.content: The ocean is not our past. It's our future.
That's what you want to believe. No one else in the fleet does. The old generation is dead. The stories they told should've died with them.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Give me the compass, Juana. Don't make me take it.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I'd like to see you try.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Don't you understand?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You really think I made the decision to hand it over to the Inquisition on my own?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: A mutiny... So this is what was waiting for me.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: What a surprise.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: All I want is the compass. All they want is a peaceful future.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Give us what we want, and you can still be our leader. Nothing has to change.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Nothing will change? Don't tell me you actually believe that, Javi?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Stop fooling yourself. At the very least, I wouldn't trust you like before.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Sorry to do this to you, boss, but the sea's no place to call home.
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: We just wanna leave the Flat and live a better life.
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: Put down your weapons, go back to your tents, and I'll pretend none of this happened.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: We're out of options, mates.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: We can't keep fooling ourselves.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...Sorry I'm late.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Mmphâ€”! Let go of me!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: The hell I will, you finshit eater. I still got the marks from the ropes!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You said nobody would know about this mutiny, Javier!
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: ...Mierda!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I found SeÃ±or Rus 'lost' on the Salt Flat, so I brought him back.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: What's this about, Javier?
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: Now now, I wouldn't make any wrong moves if I were you. Not if you still care about your friend here.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Shut up! This is none of your business, outsider!
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: What do you suggest we do then?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: To fight them of course! Burn that blasted town to the ground and take back what's ours!
attributes.name: Angry Sailor

attributes.content: You're going against the boss over some finshit scheme to kneel before the Inquisition? Did you lose your spine like a gutted fin?
attributes.name: Angry Sailor

attributes.content: They just killed so many of us and took our supplies, and you can't wait to grovel to them, Javier?
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: I know Juana taught you better than that.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: We're tired, wounded, and can barely muster up half a scrap of food. How're we supposed to fight?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Besides, those Inquisition capullos wouldn't even be after us if that dumb girl didn't bring the compass here.
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: Er, SeÃ±ora Juana...?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: So just give them the girl! What do you think you're doing, turning yourselves in along with her?
attributes.name: Angry Sailor

attributes.content: Teach...?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Enough, this isn't helping.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Yeah, why haven't we handed her over yet?
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: Urk!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: SeÃ±ores and seÃ±oras, if I may say something...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You shut your mouth!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Cold sweat runs down Pascuala's back as the pirates point their cutlasses at her.
She gulps and tries to wipe her sweaty palms on her pants.
She knows there is only ever one way to get what she wants: fight for it with her own two hands.
Come on, guys, what are you doing to one little girl?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Pelirrojito, youâ€”
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: So many adults in the room, and the best you can come up with is to hand over a child?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Enough already!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Hey, I'm speaking up for you!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I know! But I can speak for myself!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You folks wanna hand me over? Sure! Why not?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I get why you'd want to beat the finshit out of me, and I'm sure you get why I scammed you.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Violence and deception. That's how we survive. That's all we know.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: But you know how they do things in town. Do you really think handing me and the compass over will help you even one bit?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: But if you don't, the Inquisition bastards will keep hunting you, and that won't go so well for you either, no?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: So what's your point? We're screwed either way?
attributes.name: Angry Sailor

attributes.content: One week.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Give us one week to fix up that compass!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Yes. I just need a little more time.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: If he succeeds, the compass will guide us to the sea, where those finshits will never find us again!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If he doesn't, well, it won't be too late to hand me over and see how that goes!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Not like we could escape with the whole crew watching our every move. What difference could one week make?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: In Iberia, you escape one barren hellhole only to end up in another.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Outside the country, your life isn't your own without cold hard cash! It belongs to whoever's paying you!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: SeÃ±ora Juana isn't taking you out to sea just to die. What do you think she's trying to do?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You should know better than me how smart she is. She'd have been way better off leaving your sorry asses behind ages ago.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: She could've held your lives in her hands and made you work for pennies, but she didn't.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: She just wanted you to be free.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: That compass is your ticket to fame and fortune, just like your forefathers! How could you call yourselves pirates, when you've never even seen the sea?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Pascuala feels like her heart is about to leap from her chest. Her clothes are soaked with sweat.
The room is completely silent. She forces a smile and turns to look at Juana, Teach, Isidro, and Elysium behind her, who answer with approving eyes.
Uh... still letting all that sink in?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I got no problem waiting a week. But someone'll be watching you the whole time.
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: Fine by us.
attributes.name: Angry Sailor

attributes.content: Anyone else?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I object.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I said, I object!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You're letting a teenage girl make a fool of you like this? You think she knows the first thing about compasses or sailing?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I promise you, if we just get that compass and give it to the Inquisition, thenâ€”
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Sorry, Javier...
attributes.name: Hesitant Sailor

attributes.content: One sailor puts down his weapon, then another, then another. One by one, they walk out of the captain's quarters.
Only Javier and Juana are left, facing off.
I have a mission for you and Rus, Javier. You are not to return to the fleet until it's completed.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Go and pack up. You leave at nightfall.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: (Whisper) Let's go, Javier...
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: How's it going?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: We've almost reached the deadline...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: If, and I mean, IF we fail...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: How about you just don't fail!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: SeÃ±ora Juana gave you her full support. Think of everything she's done for this.
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Exiling Javier and Rus, two of her most trusted crewmates...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: She... she even killed her own...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: That's enough, Pascuala.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: He knows what needs to be done.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Anxious Sailor

attributes.content: Stop sighing your heart out.
attributes.name: Impassionate Sailor

attributes.content: Today's the day. Aren't you anxious?
attributes.name: Anxious Sailor

attributes.content: What's the use of worrying? Just think about what life would be like if that compass really paid off.
attributes.name: Impassionate Sailor

attributes.content: Aye... but what if he fails?
attributes.name: Anxious Sailor

attributes.content: Man, they're really packed around the room. Not even a grain of salt could slip through.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I have a bad feeling about this...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: C'mon, don't jinx us like that.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Still...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: He's refused any help these last few days, holing himself up in his lab...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: He wouldn't let us participate, not even today. Said the experiments require precise control, said that he didn't want to be disturbed.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But if I know anything about him, and I definitely do... he's doing this because he doesn't want to drag anyone else into it.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Maybe he's preparing to fail.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But the repairs aren't done yet, are they?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: That's just how Thorns is. He always expects the worst, and braces himself for it.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: What was that?!
attributes.name: Anxious Sailor

attributes.content: The layers of Arts energy field on the transmutation table collapse in an instant. The metallic substance that had gleamed with a shiny glow a moment ago is now a pile of charred mud.
Isidro pulled the probe back just in time to avoid damaging it, but the compass parts he had assembled now lie in pieces.
Isidro runs his fingers through the black mud, trying to figure out the reason for the failure.
But the mud holds no answers. All the clever ideas, the well-laid plans that he had put into it are nowhere to be found.
We're out of time...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Why did I think I could replicate it in such a short time?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I should have known better... master said it took even the most skilled alchemists decades to create Corazonix...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: The rusted Corazonix lies still in his pocket, as though mocking his incompetence.
What happened?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: She needed no answer. Broken parts litter the ground. The young man sits with his head hanging.
I'm sorry, Juana. I failed.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: It's alright, Isidro. This was my own choice.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I'll face the consequences.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: It's too risky.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You heard the news. The kid failed. The compass is destroyed.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: All the more reason you shouldn't go.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: The Inquisition's demands were the compass and blueprints for a salt ship. How're you supposed to parley when we got neither?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Nobody said anything about delivering them personally.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: We just need to tell them where to pick them up themselves.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You look like someone who can be reasoned with.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: If you mean the mate I sent to parley was too vulgar for you, no need to mince words.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: No, what I mean is that you must understand that trust is the basis for all cooperation.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: I wouldn't have come myself if I wasn't trustworthy.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And yet you've come empty-handed, asking me to go into the Salt Flat myself to retrieve the bargaining chips you're promising?
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: How am I to know you're not leading me into an ambush, with a hundred bandits armed to the teeth waiting for me?
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: Or maybe, I'm offering you more than just the compass and blueprints, but also the location of the pirate base and crewmen who already know how to sail a salt ship?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: No, Javier! This was supposed to give us a safe future, not make us their slaves!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Still better than following Juana to a watery death without the compass.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Besides, if you can understand, they can too. They'll cooperate when the Inquisition shows up.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...What about Juana?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: If I'm putting more chips on the table, then I need more in return.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Spare Juana.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...You will personally lead the way.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Negotiations are not over yet, SeÃ±or Alguacil.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: Is that my concern?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...What are you thinking?
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: He clearly isn't here in good faith. This so-called base of theirs is most certainly a trap.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: Let me say this again: We have neither the manpower nor the resources for another major campaign.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: My men are in good shape. As for yours... I will ensure they are ready.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I do not doubt your ability, but even if you do defeat the bandits, we cannot afford any more casualties.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: We will lack the manpower to build a ship, even if we acquire the blueprints. AarÃ³n will remain trapped in the Salt Flat.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: Your negotiations, your deals, none of this is my concern. I have gleaned the location of my enemies, and now I will act.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: The ships the bandits have used in their sin shall be put to the torch, along with their blueprints.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: As for the sinners... I will exterminate them.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Under whose authority?! The clerics you command grew up in AarÃ³n. We've gone through countless hardships together.
attributes.name: Silver

attributes.content: Yet you fail to understand them... Nay, you have betrayed them.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: So why do you assume they will listen to you?
attributes.name: Anastasio
